we are also seeking to bring justice in cases where where suspects are still being saw, the individuals that you see in these video and are photographs. 
Again we need help from the public solving these cases with our continuing work.

title: Watch as @NYPDShea updates the media on new Asian hate crime initiatives.

name: NYPD
title: Watch as @NYPDShea updates the media on new Asian hate crime initiatives.
description:
The defendant is accused of brutally, shaving, kicking and stumping a 65-year old mother to the ground after telling her that she didn't belong to here. So let me join the commissioner in being clear, this brave women belongs here. Asian American New Yorkers belong here. Everyone belongs here. Attacks against Asian American New Yorkers are against all New Yorkers and our officers will continue to stand against hate in all its forms. 
Mr Elliot will be arranged shortly in Manhattan criminal court on two counts of assault and second degree as a hate crime and one count of an attempted assault in the first degree as a Hate crime. If convicted, he will face up to 25 year in prison as well as other sequence during rest life of his patrol.

name: NYPD
title: police
description:
WANTED for HATE CRIME ASSAULT: the individual attacked the 56 year-old Asian male victim by punching him in the face, rendering him unconscious. 
EMS responded and transported the victim to an area hospital for treatment of a laceration to his lip, a black eye, and swelling to his head.

title: Watch as @NYPDShea updates the media on new Asian hate crime initiatives.

name: New-York-Times
title: To Combat Anti-Asian Attacks, New Yorkers Join Neighborhood Watch Patrols
description:
A third group would patrol the blocks between Union Street and College Point Boulevard on Roosevelt Avenue, where a man violently shoved an Asian-American woman to the ground outside a bakery in February.
Asian-Americans are grappling with fear, rage and anxiety brought on by attacks against people of Asian descent, particularly older men and women. In an especially egregious episode a little more than a week ago, a 65-year-old Filipino woman was brutally assaulted in broad daylight outside a luxury apartment building in Midtown Manhattan. Two lobby staff members who witnessed the assault but failed to intervene have been fired.The New York Police Department has received 35 reports of anti-Asian hate crimes already this year, compared with 28 in all of 2020 and only three in 2019. Officials say the data fails to paint a full picture, as many incidents go unreported or are not categorized as hate crimes.

name: New-York-Times
title: In the Philippines, Attacks on Asian-Americans Threaten ‘Family’
description:
MANILA — When a Filipino immigrant was brutally attacked this week on a New York City sidewalk
In early February, a 61-year-old Filipino-American man was attacked with a box cutter on the subway after he confronted a stranger who had kicked his tote bag.

name: New-York-Times
title: An Asian American Poet on Refusing to Take Up ‘Apologetic Space’
description:
This week, a Filipino woman was attacked in Midtown Manhattan during broad daylight. This assault came on 
the heels of the Atlanta-area shooting in which six women of Asian descent were killed and amid reports of rising crime against Asians.

name: New-York-Times
title: Man Arrested in Anti-Asian Attack Was on Parole for Killing His Mother
description:
He was seen on security footage brutally assaulting Vilma Kari, 65, as she was walking to church on Monday morning, the police said.
Mr. Elliot was being charged with two counts of assault as a hate crime and one count of attempted assault as a hate crime, Manhattan’s district attorney, Cyrus R. Vance Jr., said at a news conference.
he approached her shouting, “You don’t belong here,” singling her out as Asian, and following up with words that Ms. Kari said she was unable to hear.
Ms. Kari suffered a fractured pelvis and contusions on her body and forehead, according to the draft complaint.

name: New-York-Times
title: Prabal Gurung on Anti-Asian Violence, Discrimination and the Duties of Success
description: Prabal Gurung:“To watch a video of a 65-year-old woman being brutally attacked is triggering and heart-wrenching, not just for me but for my friends and people from my community.”

name: New-York-Times
title: In Broad Daylight, Another Anti-Asian Attack
description:
A 65-year-old Filipino immigrant was walking in Midtown Manhattan when a man kicked her in the stomach, knocking her to the ground. The man repeatedly kicked her in the head and told her, “You don’t belong here,” the police said.
The attack, which happened in broad daylight , a security guard closed the door as Ms. Kari struggled to get up.

name: New-York-Times
title: Biden Announces Actions to Combat Anti-Asian Attacks
description: The steps by the federal government to combat racist violence came a day after a man was captured on surveillance video in New York stomping on a 65-year-old Filipino woman while making anti-Asian remarks.

name: New-York-Times
title: Brutal Attack on Filipino Woman Sparks Outrage: ‘Everybody Is on Edge’
description:
The security camera video was shocking in its brutality. A 65-year-old Filipino immigrant was walking down a street near Times Square when a man, in broad daylight, suddenly kicked her in the stomach.
She crumpled to the sidewalk. He kicked her once in the head. Then again. And again. He yelled an obscenity at her, according to a police official, and then said, “You don’t belong here.”
As the violent scene unfolded in Manhattan, three men watched from the lobby of a nearby luxury apartment building. When the woman struggled to stand up, one of the men, a security guard, closed the front door to the building.

name: New-York-Times
title: Attack on Asian Woman in Midtown Prompts Another Hate Crime Investigation
description: A man kicked a 65-year-old woman to the ground in broad daylight on a Midtown Manhattan sidewalk on Monday, stomped on her several times and made anti-Asian remarks in what the police called another targeted hate crime.

name: New-York-Times
title: Asian-Americans Are Being Attacked. Why Are Hate Crime Charges So Rare?
description:
On a cold evening last month, a Chinese man was walking home near Manhattan’s Chinatown neighborhood when a stranger suddenly ran up behind him and plunged a knife into his back.
For many Asian-Americans, the stabbing was horrifying, but not surprising. It was widely seen as just the latest example of racially targeted violence against Asians during the pandemic.
But the perpetrator, a 23-year-old man from Yemen, had not said a word to the victim before the attack, investigators said. Prosecutors determined they lacked enough evidence to prove a racist motive. The attacker was charged with attempted murder, but not as a hate crime.

name: New-York-Times
title: Attacks on Asian-Americans in New York Stoke Fear, Anxiety and Anger
description: “I’ve never cried like that before,” Ms. Cheng said, describing her reaction to security footage that showed her mother being shoved to the ground last week on a crowded street in Flushing, Queens. “To see my mother get thrown like that, she looks like a feather. She looks like a rag doll.”

name: New-York-Times
title: Attacks Against Asian New Yorkers: What to Know
description:
Asian-American communities have been holding vigils and protests after a white gunman attacked Atlanta-area spas last week and killed eight people, including six women of Asian descent.
At least five people of Asian descent were attacked in the city over the weekend. On Sunday alone, three people were attacked, including one woman who had attended a demonstration in support of Asian-American victims that day.

name: New-York-Times
title: As Protesters Rally Against Anti-Asian Hate, N.Y.C. Records 5 Attacks
description:
A 68-year-old Sri Lankan man was riding the subway in Lower Manhattan on Friday when another passenger yelled a racial slur and punched him in the head, leaving him bloodied and in critical condition.
On Saturday morning, a 66-year-old man of Asian descent was punched in the face on the Lower East Side.
Then on Sunday came three more attacks

name: New-York-Times
title: What This Wave of Anti-Asian Violence Reveals About America
description: A 23-year-old Korean woman in New York was punched in the face last March and accused of having the coronavirus. More incidents followed as the virus spread, with Asian-Americans being spat on, beaten, slashed, even attacked with chemicals.

name: World-Journal
title: Suspect in attack on Asian woman arrested for killing her own mother
description: The African-American man who violently attacked a 65-year-old Asian woman on the street in Manhattan, and the 65-year-old Asian woman, Carrie, who was unjustly attacked on her way to church.

name: World-Journal
title: African-American man kicks Asian woman, yells 'you don't belong here'
description:
A 65-year-old Asian woman was on her way to church when she was suddenly kicked to the ground by an African-American man, 
who then proceeded to punch and kick her, using racial slurs and insults "fuck you, you don't belong here.

name: World-Journal
title: The film / The pursuit of villains: Asian New York subway by African-American violent assault strangled fainted
description:
Racial Discrimination? Hate Crimes? 
Comments on the New York subway brutality against African-Americans are polarized. The video of a man who appeared to be of Asian descent being violently assaulted and strangled to the point of fainting by an African-American man on the New York City subway was reposted on social media, 
causing a lot of controversy among netizens; as the victim appeared to have first uttered the "N word" in an abusive manner against African-Americans, 
some netizens said they should not start by calling out racist comments, while others said, "beating someone to death without mercy is a hate crime.

name: World-Journal
title: African-American teenager harasses laundromat, chides owner to go back to China
description: Michael Chang, a Chinese-American laundromat owner in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, for more than 10 years, said he was harassed by a group of African-American teenagers last August, who often picked up trash and threw it on the storefront, and insulted him with racial slurs. A white man passing by came to his rescue, but he was hit in the head with a chair, but fortunately his life was not in danger.

name: World-Journal
title: Asian woman beaten in face at New York subway station:Virus is all because of you
description: A 37-year-old Asian woman was punched in the face by an unknown man who screamed at her: "You Chink" and "You should go back to your country, this(COVID-19) is all because of you.

name: World-Journal
title: Asian New York subway by African-American violent assault strangled fainted
description:
A man who appears to be of Asian descent was beaten by an African-American man in a subway car in New York City with a series of heavy punches and a strong choke hold until his hands fell down and he was paralyzed and fainted. 
According to the video, which was captured by a witness, the victim appears to be of Asian descent, but the person who took the video indicated to an ABC television reporter that he looked Hispanic.

name: World-Journal
title: SNL Chinese Anchor Criticizes Asia-Hating Crimes, Wants 'Grannies to Move'
description:
The 30-year-old Yang Bo Wen, one of the first Asian actors to debut on the comedy show, said in a rare serious tone, 
"If it's in some people's nature to beat up an Asian grandmother, that's not communication at all. My grandmother is Asian, and if you want to hit her, we have absolutely nothing in common.

name: World-Journal
title: Man who called a 65-year-old Asian woman a "stupid blue-haired Chinese" is charged with a hate crime
description:
A 65-year-old Asian woman was teased about her blue hair color and was verbally assaulted on the street by someone who said, "You stupid blue-haired Chink, you Chinese bitch.
According to city police, Bobby Eli, 48, of East Harlem, saw a 65-year-old Asian woman near the Port Authority on West 40th Street in Midtown and started making fun of her blue hair.
After hearing the taunting, the woman turned to Eli and Eli went further to address her racial taunts by saying, "You stupid blue-haired Chink, you Chinese bitch, why do you have blue hair?
While he was jeering, Avery waved an unidentified object in his hand at the victim, and the cart he was pushing also contained other unidentified objects.

name: World-Journal
title: New York City housing inspector sends letter to Asian residents addressed to "Ching Chong
description:
An employee sent a letter signed "Ching Chong" to an Asian resident of Manhattan's Upper East Side after inspecting his apartment; 
the city later confirmed that the person who sent the letter was the one who sent the anti-Asian racial slur.

name: World-Journal
title: Asian seniors in Manhattan hit with racial slurs, suspect swings bat and flees
description: A 65-year-old Asian senior citizen was attacked with anti-Asian racial slurs and then threatened with a club-like weapon in Manhattan, New York.

name: World-Journal
title: Chinese elderly couple attacked to help the bus driver: can not sit idly by
description: A Chinese couple was attacked by an African-American man while they were walking with their shopping bags in Benson Heights, Brooklyn. The suspect spit on him and punched him in the face.

name: World-Journal
title: New York Chinese Police Officer Called "Soy Sauce" by African-American Man on BLM Parade Duty, "Eats Dogs and Cats" for 15 Minutes
description:
A Chinatown police officer was on duty for the "Black Lives Are Lives" march when an African-American man insulted him for 15 minutes with racial slurs such as "soy sauce" and "eat cats and dogs".
The officer, who has been with the Chinatown Police Department for more than 16 years, was sent to the Stonewall neighborhood to coordinate a march for the African-American civil rights movement, and while he was standing with other white officers, an African-American protester walked right up to him and made a series of anti-Asian racial slurs.

name: World-Journal
title: Flushing man verbally assaults Asian and knocks down cell phone
description: Police said that at about 5:20 p.m. on the evening of the 21st, in front of 41-25 Kissena Blvd. in Flushing, a 34-year-old Asian man had an argument with the suspect, and then the Asian man took out his cell phone and started shooting video. The Asian victim's cell phone was damaged, but no one was injured in the case.

name: World-Journal
title: Man involved in verbal assault on Asian on Route 7 knocks down cell phone, Hate Crimes Unit involved in investigation
description:
According to police sources, a 35-year-old Asian woman reported that at 11:30 a.m. that day, she was riding the No. 7 subway at Flushing's Main Street when an unknown African-American man in the same car kept making hateful comments about Asians.
The victim said she was answering the phone in her mother tongue when the African-American man suddenly approached her and knocked her Samsung S9 phone out of her hand; the woman said her phone was knocked to the ground and broken, and the other man kept making insulting remarks about Asians during the attack, so she fled the subway immediately for fear of being attacked again.

name: World-Journal
title: White man allegedly urinates on 25-year-old Chinese woman on Queens subway
description:
Ms. Chen, a 25-year-old Chinese victim, told AsianFeed, "As I was sitting on the F-Line subway to Queens, a white man walked into the car, he came in from the back of the car, stopped next to me and later started to approach me, I felt uncomfortable and moved to the right, then I found his lower body facing me, and urine appeared on my bag and jacket.
Ms. Chen said, "I looked at him, but he didn't say anything, I just said to him, 'Are you serious? (Are you serious?) As I looked around, none of the bystanders said or did anything, and the man got off at 75th Avenue.

name: World-Journal
title: Chinese woman robbed of placard and beaten at anti-Asian protest
description:
A 37-year-old Chinese woman named Hou was on her way to one of the demonstrations against violence against Asians in Downtown when an unidentified man approached her, 
grabbed her placard with anti-Asian violence written on it, tried to throw it in the trash, and then threw it on the ground and stomped on it. When the victim asked the man why he was doing this, he punched her twice in the face.

name: World-Journal
title: Chinese woman robbed of placard and beaten at anti-Asian protest
description:
The victim, a 61-year-old Asian man, was walking down the street when a man from a parked gray sedan suddenly came up to him and knocked him to the ground.
The victim tried to resist, but the assailant, wearing a steel finger tiger, punched him so hard that his head was broken and bleeding.

name: World-Journal
title: Asian Elder Attacked in New York Subway, Suspect Curses 'Damn Asians' in Hate Crime Investigation
description:
An elderly Sri Lankan Asian man in his 70s was innocently attacked by an African-American in the subway. The suspect first shouted "You motherf-king Asian" at him.
Witnesses said the victim was "covered in blood" within seconds and was taken to the hospital but not in life-threatening condition.

name: World-Journal
title: New York Chinese woman assaulted in the street for no reason, assailant arrested that night
description:
A 54-year-old Chinese woman was beaten by a man with an iron bar for no apparent reason on the street in Chinatown, resulting in bleeding.
Police said the Chinese woman was walking on Grand St. and Ludlow St. when the suspect, 34-year-old Elias Guerrero, approached her with a weapon and shouted, "Damn Asians! (f-king Asians!)
Witnesses said the victim was walking on the street in Chinatown at 5:00 p.m. when he was attacked by the man for no apparent reason, and that he hit the victim in the head with a metal bat; the suspect not only used racial slurs and insults several times during the violence, but also said, "I'm here to mess with Asians.

name: World-Journal
title: Lower East Side protesters shout "Chinese" and beat Chinese man, police investigate as potential hate crime
description:
The suspect not only threatened but also shouted "Chinese" several times, and police are investigating the case as a potential hate crime.
The assailant told the Chinese victim, "If I see you around here again, I'll beat you up again. And "I'm going to beat you up now. The suspect punched the victim right in the face, above the eyes, and the victim froze in place after the attack, said Lin, a Chinese witness.

name: World-Journal
title: Why is it so difficult to prosecute hate crimes when Asians are often attacked?
description:
The shooting at the massage parlor in Atlanta, as well as the many attacks on Asians before that, have rarely resulted in arrests or indictments on hate charges. Police say that racial hate charges against Asians lack clear definitions, unlike the hanging of African-Americans and Jews or the Nazi anti-wannabe symbols, and that it is difficult to determine the motive of the suspect for attacking Asians.

The New York Times reported that one night in February, a Chinese man was walking back to his house in the Manhattan neighborhood of New York City when a stranger appeared out of nowhere and stabbed him in the back.

name: World-Journal
title: Asian woman walking her dog near Chinatown suddenly spit on and called "Fucking Chink
description: Police said the 33-year-old Asian victim was walking her dog near 12 Spring Street, not far from Chinatown, at about 8 p.m. on the 17th when an unknown man started shouting "Chink" at her and spitting at her, and the victim asked her why she was being yelled at, and the man continued to shout "stupid Chink" at her and told her to "go back to her country.

name: World-Journal
title: The white woman who called the Korean woman "go back to Communist China" is the daughter of the late U.S. Senator.
description:
The identity of the white woman who attacked a Korean woman on a Manhattan street, yelling at her to "go back to Communist China," was revealed to be Maura 
Moynihan, daughter of the late Democratic U.S. Senator Daniel Patrick Moynihan, but she claimed she had no racial bias or prejudice against Asians. Police defined the incident as a harassment.

name: World-Journal
title: Chinese man arrested and charged for leaving messages and graffiti "Kill the Chinese Nazis" 6 times
description:
A Chinese-American man is suspected of leaving hate speech graffiti or notes such as "Kill the Chinese" ”Overthrew all Chinese Banks; Kill Chinese Nazisand 
Nazi“ swastikas on at least six shopping malls and billboards in Flushing last week, police said on the 17th that he was arrested and brought to justice for hate crimes, crminal damage and graffiti.

name: World-Journal
title: Korean blogger gets yelled at by white woman in Manhattan: "Go back to communist China, x"
description: A Korean fashion blogger in New York was yelled at by a white woman on the 14th while she was out shooting, You're not from here, go back to communist China bitch.

name: World-Journal
title: Flushing Mall: "Kill the Chinese Nazis
description:
In the restroom of the mall building located at 42-35 Main Street in Flushing, it was revealed that a paper 
towel with the message "Overthrew all Chinese Banks; Kill Chinese Nazis" was posted, causing concern to the surrounding businesses.

name: World-Journal
title: Korean woman in her 80s spat on, beaten into coma by protesters in Westchester County, New York
description:
A Westchester County woman in her eighties was attacked for no reason by a transient while scavenging 
outside a shopping center this week, spitting and then being beaten, causing her to fall unconscious on the ground.

name: World-Journal
title: Korean woman in her 80s spat on, beaten into coma by protesters in Westchester County, New York
description: A 25-year-old Korean mother was verbally abused with a Chinese virus and spat on three times in the streets of Fresh Meadows.

name: World-Journal
title: Asian mother and son insulted with "Chinese virus" Asian Hate Crimes Task Force steps in to investigate
description: A mother and son of Asian descent in Queens were spat on three times by racists in the street during the day, and insulted the "Chinese virus", triggering discontent in the Asian community; for this, the city police "Asian Hate Crimes Task Force" said on the 11th, the team of officers have been involved in the investigation of the case, appealing for information to provide clues to the suspects.

name: World-Journal
title: The victim, Zhang Mingshun, urged the Chinese to report the incident.
description:
A strange man standing at the entrance of the subway station, waiting for 56-year-old Zhang Mingshun approached, suddenly turned and fist fight, Zhang 
Mingshun was beaten and fell to the ground, hit his head, the man continued to beat him until he lost consciousness before stopping, easily over the subway gate, walking into the subway station.

name: World-Journal
title: Chinese stabbed, turned in suspect with history of mental illness, not charged with hate crime
description:
The suspect, Salman Muflihi, who stabbed a 36-year-old Chinese man for no reason on the street in Manhattan's Chinatown, was charged with attempted 
second-degree murder, but prosecutors did not charge him with a hate crime; police said Muflihi turned himself in to police and said, "I stabbed that man, he's dead, I don't care.

name: World-Journal
title: New York subway "kill the Chinese" graffiti city police: has notified the MTA to clean up
description: A Chinese passenger on an R train saw "Kill Chinks" scrawled on a seat and immediately reported it to the Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA). After a week of waiting, the police and MTA contacted the passenger and told him that the graffiti would be cleaned up.

name: World-Journal
title: Chinese manager of gym is insulted, "Go back to China", man fired for discrimination
description: A man in Brooklyn was filmed by a member of the public after he insulted a Chinese male manager of Blink Fitness for "going back to China" after being asked to wear a mask. The man, a real estate agent, was also fired from his job as a result of the incident.

name: World-Journal
title: Chinese murder masks found on the streets of Brooklyn's Chinese community
description:
A muzzle with "China Kills" written on it suddenly appeared on the street in Brooklyn's Chinese neighborhood of Dyker Heights on the 14th.
Hazel Chen, a Chinese woman living in Dyker Heights, was walking to the grocery store at around 10:40 a.m. on the morning of the 14th when she spotted a mask on the ground at the corner of 13th Avenue and 66th Street with the words "China Kills" written on it in black marker.

name: World-Journal
title: Lower East Side protesters shout "Chinese" and assault Chinese man, police investigate as potential hate crime
description:
A Chinese man was beaten by a prowler with his fists in the street. The suspect not only made threats, but also shouted "Chinese" several times, which police have classified as a potential hate crime investigation.
Police said the case happened at about 9 a.m. on the 20th, when a Chinese man parked his car in front of 196 Allen St. near Houston St. He was getting out of his car to check his parking meter to make sure he could park; then a prowler approached him and raised his fist and hit him in the head.

name: World-Journal
title: Chinese woman on Long Island was choked in the street and almost lost her eyesight
description:
The Nassau County Sheriff's Office has zero records of Asian hate crimes, but there are many cases of insults and attacks against Asians in the community, said Long Island Chinese Association President Michael Chang.
He said a Nassau County public hospital employee recently told him that a Chinese woman was choked by a foreigner on the street for no apparent reason and was then repeatedly punched in the eye, causing the woman to be nearly blinded when she was taken to the hospital.

name: World-Journal
title: New York Asian Teenager Attacked in Park: "Stupid Chinese, Go Back to Your Country
description: A 13-year-old Asian teenager was pushed by multiple people near a park in Flushing, repeatedly attacked with a basketball to the head, and called "stupid Chinese, go back to your country" and other discriminatory language during the attack.

name: World-Journal
title: "Damn Chinese, go back to China" Harlem man beats Asian man in the street
description: The number of crimes against Asians continues to rise, with a hate attack in Manhattan's Harlem neighborhood occurring recently when a light-skinned man yelled "Fucking Chinese, go back to China" after hitting an Asian man on the street, followed by a fist fight. The man is now wanted by the 32nd Precinct.

name: World-Journal
title: Asian mother and son in Queens are accused of "Chinese virus" and spat on 3 times in the street
description:
A mother and son of Asian descent in Queens were racially profiled three times during the day and called "Chinese virus", triggering discontent in the Asian community.
According to the NYPD, a 25-year-old Asian woman reported that she was harassed by someone near the Flushing Kissena Corridor Park at 186th Street and Peck Avenue around 10:30 a.m. to 11:30 a.m. on the 9th.
The victim said an unknown man spat at her and her 2-year-old child three times and called them a "Chinese virus" before fleeing in an unknown direction.

name: World-Journal
title: Thousands protest against Asian discrimination in Manhattan
description:
A 36-year-old Chinese man was attacked from behind with an 8-inch knife by a 23-year-old Yemeni man on his way home from the Federal Courthouse (Daniel Patrick Moynihan U.S. Courthouse), not far from Foley Square, and was seriously injured.

But at his arraignment in Manhattan Criminal Court on the 27th, the prosecutor dropped the hate crime charges, leaving the suspect charged with attempted murder and attempted assault. The suspect was only charged with two counts of attempted murder and attempted assault.
